meanings.definition: To have doubts or suspicions about something.
meanings.sent2: I often misdoubt my own abilities.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to misdoubt the new toy, eyeing it cautiously.
meanings.sent4: Her words made him misdoubt the sincerity of her apology.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds looming overhead made him misdoubt the weather forecast.

meanings.definition: A feeling of uncertainty or suspicion.
meanings.sent1: His misdoubt grew as the day went on.
meanings.sent2: There was a sense of misdoubt in the air.
meanings.sent3: The misdoubt in her mind whispered of potential danger.
meanings.sent4: The shadowy figure in the distance sparked a wave of misdoubt.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence of the forest filled her with misdoubt.
